response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "This measure repeals the existing Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_24] It establishes a new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of conference center programs among the various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_25] The bill also appropriates funds out of the new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_27]",
  "appropriations": "There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ (HB1169_HD1) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026. [CHUNK_17] The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. [CHUNK_18]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [CHUNK_0]",
  "agency_impact": "Establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses. [CHUNK_28] This would thereby increase access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses. [CHUNK_28] The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses. [CHUNK_4]",
  "economic_impact": "Your Committee finds that establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses of the University of Hawaii System, thereby increasing access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses. [CHUNK_28] No other direct economic impact is mentioned in the provided documents. [CHUNK_0]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure amends Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by adding a new section to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_1] It repeals section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which relates to the Conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo. [CHUNK_7] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which relates to the Community college conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_11]",
  "revenue_sources": "The bill establishes the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. [CHUNK_2] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_3] On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the two repealed revolving funds shall lapse to the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_16]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing conference center services. [CHUNK_2] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_3] As of July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund, university of Hawaii at Hilo; and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the new fund. [CHUNK_16]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding any capital expenditure impact. [CHUNK_0]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [CHUNK_0]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The previous fiscal note stated that 'appropriations and encumbrances' would be transferred. [CHUNK_26] The current version clarifies that all 'unencumbered funds' in the repealed revolving funds shall 'lapse' to the new fund. [CHUNK_16] The most significant change is the effective date, which was changed from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [CHUNK_30]",
  "fte_positions": "The provided legislative documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [CHUNK_0]",
  "appropriations_changes": "The previous fiscal note indicated an unspecified appropriation for fiscal year 2025-2026. [CHUNK_17] The current version of the bill maintains this unspecified appropriation. [CHUNK_17]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "The funding source remains the newly created University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_17] No changes in funding sources have been made between versions. [CHUNK_0]",
  "department_impact": "The University of Hawaii remains the department responsible for expending the appropriated sum. [CHUNK_18] There has been no change in departmental responsibility. [CHUNK_0]",
  "reports_required": "The university shall prepare and submit an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_6]",
  "pilot_program": "The provided legislative documents do not establish a pilot program. [CHUNK_0] The bill establishes a permanent revolving fund. [CHUNK_2]",
  "sunset_date": "The provided legislative documents do not contain a sunset date for the bill or program. [CHUNK_0]",
  "effective_date": "The effective date in the previous version was July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_30] This version changes the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [CHUNK_30]"
}

parts.text:
{
  "overview": "This measure repeals the existing Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_24] It establishes a new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of conference center programs among the various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_25] The bill also appropriates funds out of the new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_27]",
  "appropriations": "There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ (HB1169_HD1) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026. [CHUNK_17] The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. [CHUNK_18]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [CHUNK_0]",
  "agency_impact": "Establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses. [CHUNK_28] This would thereby increase access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses. [CHUNK_28] The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses. [CHUNK_4]",
  "economic_impact": "Your Committee finds that establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses of the University of Hawaii System, thereby increasing access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses. [CHUNK_28] No other direct economic impact is mentioned in the provided documents. [CHUNK_0]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure amends Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by adding a new section to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_1] It repeals section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which relates to the Conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo. [CHUNK_7] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which relates to the Community college conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_11]",
  "revenue_sources": "The bill establishes the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. [CHUNK_2] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_3] On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the two repealed revolving funds shall lapse to the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [CHUNK_16]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing conference center services. [CHUNK_2] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_3] As of July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund, university of Hawaii at Hilo; and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the new fund. [CHUNK_16]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding any capital expenditure impact. [CHUNK_0]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [CHUNK_0]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The previous fiscal note stated that 'appropriations and encumbrances' would be transferred. [CHUNK_26] The current version clarifies that all 'unencumbered funds' in the repealed revolving funds shall 'lapse' to the new fund. [CHUNK_16] The most significant change is the effective date, which was changed from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [CHUNK_30]",
  "fte_positions": "The provided legislative documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [CHUNK_0]",
  "appropriations_changes": "The previous fiscal note indicated an unspecified appropriation for fiscal year 2025-2026. [CHUNK_17] The current version of the bill maintains this unspecified appropriation. [CHUNK_17]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "The funding source remains the newly created University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_17] No changes in funding sources have been made between versions. [CHUNK_0]",
  "department_impact": "The University of Hawaii remains the department responsible for expending the appropriated sum. [CHUNK_18] There has been no change in departmental responsibility. [CHUNK_0]",
  "reports_required": "The university shall prepare and submit an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. [CHUNK_6]",
  "pilot_program": "The provided legislative documents do not establish a pilot program. [CHUNK_0] The bill establishes a permanent revolving fund. [CHUNK_2]",
  "sunset_date": "The provided legislative documents do not contain a sunset date for the bill or program. [CHUNK_0]",
  "effective_date": "The effective date in the previous version was July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_30] This version changes the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [CHUNK_30]"

chunk_details.chunk_text: HB1169 HD1 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 1169 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 H.D. 1 STATE OF HAWAII A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is

OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding to part V, subpart D, a new section to be appropriately designated and to read as follows: " §304A- University of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving

There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of

moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The university may establish accounts under the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses and operating units

of this fund among the various campuses and operating units of the university of Hawaii system. The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs, including but not

courses provided by the conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and other conference related services, fees, supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any

supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The university shall prepare and submit an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. " SECTION 2. Section 304A-2272,

account within the revolving fund. " SECTION 2. Section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" §304A-2272 Conference center revolving fund; University of Hawaii at Hilo. (a) There is established the conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the University of Hawaii at Hilo. All fees, charges,

by the University of Hawaii at Hilo. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with conference center programs shall be deposited in the revolving fund. The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo or the chancellorꞌs designee is authorized to expend funds from the revolving fund for

is authorized to expend funds from the revolving fund for all costs associated with conferences, seminars, and courses provided by conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment,

mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to chapter 103D. (b) The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to

to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session that includes an accounting for all income and expenditures of the revolving fund under this section. "] SECTION 3. Section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" [§304A-2273] Community college conference center revolving fund.

is repealed. [" [§304A-2273] Community college conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the community college conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the various community colleges. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center program of each community college shall

with the conference center program of each community college shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The chancellor of each community college or a designee is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and

fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses by the conference center program, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, leis, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard

of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The chancellors of the community colleges shall prepare an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the

all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. "] SECTION 4. On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund, university of Hawaii at Hilo; and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the university of Hawaii conference

revolving fund shall lapse to the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. SECTION 5. There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal

or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026. The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. SECTION 6. Statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored. SECTION 7. This Act shall take

statutory material is underscored. SECTION 7. This Act shall take effect on July 1, 3000. Report Title: UH; Conference Center Revolving Fund; Appropriation Description: Establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating

fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii system. Repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. Lapses all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii

encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Appropriates funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Effective 7/1/3000. (HD1) The summary description of legislation appearing
Fund. Effective 7/1/3000. (HD1) The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.

HSCR308 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 308 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 1169 H.D. 1 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madame: Your Committee on Higher Education, to which was referred H.B. No. 1169 entitled: "A BILL

to which was referred H.B. No. 1169 entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Repeal the existing Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the

Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund; (2) Establish a new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii

various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System; (3) Transfer all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund; and (4) Appropriate funds out

Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund; and (4) Appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the University of Hawai ʻ i System. Your Committee finds that establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University

establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses of the University of Hawaii System, thereby increasing access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses. Your Committee has amended this measure by: (1)

Hawaii campuses. Your Committee has amended this measure by: (1) Clarifying that all unencumbered funds in the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund shall lapse to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund on the effective date of

Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund on the effective date of this measure; (2) Changing the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion; and (3) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of

affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Higher Education that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Second Reading in the form attached hereto

that it pass Second Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, and be referred to your Committee on Finance. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Higher Education, ____________________________ ANDREW TAKUYA GARRETT, Chair

overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fiscal note. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fiscal note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.

NO. 1169 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 H.D. 1 STATE OF HAWAII A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is

OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding to part V, subpart D, a new section to be appropriately designated and to read as follows: " §304A- University of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving

There is established the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of

moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The university may establish accounts under the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund to facilitate the administration of this fund among the various campuses and operating units

of this fund among the various campuses and operating units of the university of Hawaii system. The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs, including but not

courses provided by the conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and other conference related services, fees, supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any

supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The university shall prepare and submit an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. " SECTION 2. Section 304A-2272,

account within the revolving fund. " SECTION 2. Section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" §304A-2272 Conference center revolving fund; University of Hawaii at Hilo. (a) There is established the conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the University of Hawaii at Hilo. All fees, charges,

by the University of Hawaii at Hilo. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with conference center programs shall be deposited in the revolving fund. The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo or the chancellorꞌs designee is authorized to expend funds from the revolving fund for

is authorized to expend funds from the revolving fund for all costs associated with conferences, seminars, and courses provided by conference center programs, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment,

mailing, airfare and per diem, lei, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to chapter 103D. (b) The chancellor of the University of Hawaii at Hilo shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to

to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session that includes an accounting for all income and expenditures of the revolving fund under this section. "] SECTION 3. Section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is repealed. [" [§304A-2273] Community college conference center revolving fund.

is repealed. [" [§304A-2273] Community college conference center revolving fund. (a) There is established the community college conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the various community colleges. All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center program of each community college shall

with the conference center program of each community college shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. The chancellor of each community college or a designee is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and

fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses by the conference center program, including but not limited to expenses for honoraria, hotel and room rentals, food and refreshment, printing and mailing, airfare and per diem, leis, rental of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard

of audiovisual equipment, and conference supplies and materials, without regard to section 103D-1002 and any competitive bidding requirements pursuant to state procurement requirements. (b) The chancellors of the community colleges shall prepare an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the

all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. "] SECTION 4. On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund, university of Hawaii at Hilo; and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the university of Hawaii conference

revolving fund shall lapse to the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. SECTION 5. There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal

or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026. The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. SECTION 6. Statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored. SECTION 7. This Act shall take

statutory material is underscored. SECTION 7. This Act shall take effect on July 1, 3000. Report Title: UH; Conference Center Revolving Fund; Appropriation Description: Establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating

fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii system. Repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. Lapses all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii

encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Appropriates funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Effective 7/1/3000. (HD1) The summary description of legislation appearing
Fund. Effective 7/1/3000. (HD1) The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.

HSCR308 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 308 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 1169 H.D. 1 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madame: Your Committee on Higher Education, to which was referred H.B. No. 1169 entitled: "A BILL

to which was referred H.B. No. 1169 entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Repeal the existing Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the

Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund; (2) Establish a new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii

various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System; (3) Transfer all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund; and (4) Appropriate funds out

Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund; and (4) Appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the University of Hawai ʻ i System. Your Committee finds that establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University

establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses of the University of Hawaii System, thereby increasing access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses. Your Committee has amended this measure by: (1)

Hawaii campuses. Your Committee has amended this measure by: (1) Clarifying that all unencumbered funds in the Conference Center Revolving Fund, University of Hawaii at Hilo; and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund shall lapse to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund on the effective date of

Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund on the effective date of this measure; (2) Changing the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion; and (3) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of

affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Higher Education that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Second Reading in the form attached hereto

that it pass Second Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, and be referred to your Committee on Finance. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Higher Education, ____________________________ ANDREW TAKUYA GARRETT, Chair
